sub_title: Retired Head of Finance, Risk & Compliance at Clifford Chance LLP, author and guest speaker
summary:
After I suffered a stroke I am no longer able to work as Head of finance, risk & compliance at Clifford Chance LLP. The reason I suffered stroke at such a young age, while I am otherwise very healthy, is that I have a hereditary disease of brain blood vessels called CADASIL. 
CADASIL leads to a reduced blood flow to the brain and therefore strokes resulting in progressive disability. After I had to stop working, I decided to write a book about CADASIL and this terrible disease has affected me, my wife and our young family. My book 'Shouldn't I be dead already?' has been published in May 2023. If you are interested to read about how we have coped with all the challenges that have come our way due to CADASIL, you can order the book via my website www.levenmetcadasil.com/boek

Terwijl ik in Amsterdam werkte als Head of finance, risk & compliance bij Clifford Chance LLP kreeg ik een herseninfarct. Dit herseninfarct was het gevolg van een ziekte met de naam Cadasil. Cadasil is een ziekte die leidt tot een verminderde bloedtoevoer naar de hersenen, en die hoogstwaarschijnlijk zal leiden tot de dood. Toen ik noodgedwongen moest stoppen met werken, ben ik begonnen met het schrijven van een ervaringsverhaal over deze ziekte en de impact die dit heeft op een jong gezin. 
Begin mei is mijn boek met de titel ‘Ik had toch al dood moeten zijn?’ uitgebracht. Het boek is onder andere te bestellen via mijn website www.levenmetcadasil.com/boek

projects.title: Establish the Foundation for safety of the industrial zone De Ronde Venen
projects.description:
The purpose of this Public Private Partnership foundation is, as mentioned in its articles of Association: "improve the safety of the business park for the foundation members". It is clear that this objective in particular is aimed at the security domain. 
The main reason for its establishment was the ever increasing number of crime on the business park which caused deterioration of the business climate. That is why the Foundation coordinates the municipality, police, the fire department and the industrial lobby, who are all working in close cooperation to improve the safety of the business park.

Clifford Chance is one of the world's leading law firms with 35 offices in 25 countries with some 3,400 legal advisors. Our Amsterdam office is a challenging, dynamic, international environment to work in. Our clients represent the top of the national and international business community. 

Employed as Head of Finance, Risk & Compliance responsible for the departments Financial Accounting, Billing & Collections, Business Analysis and Risk & Complenace , with a finance team that currently consists of 11 people in our Amsterdam office and around 15 people working in our Shared Service Centre in Delhi, India. 

My responsibilities in more detail:
• as a member of the Global Finance Leadership Group responsible for several international finance related projects
• co-heading the global finance systems community, simplifying and standardizing the applications architecture and act as the interface between the global finance function and IT
• Internal and external reporting for Amsterdam office and Notary practice
• Responsible for the budget and rolling forecast
• Optimization of working capital
• Responsible for adequate financial controlling, support and advice through analysis and recommendations concerning strategy and operational management, act as a sparring partner for the partners of our Office
• Responsible for business controlling, ensuring analysis of the financial and business information in relation to clients and businesses in order to provide information and advice for decisions relating to profit objectives
• Promoting operational excellence to progress towards lean and standardized services and to improve process efficiency / continuous improvement
• First point of contact for internal & external auditors, tax authorities, banks, fiscal experts and Bureau Financieel Toezicht
• Member of the Risk & Compliance Committee, Innovation Committee, Crisis Management Team

I have volunteered for an initiative of Habitat for Humanity in the Netherlands. Together with a team of  12 Financial Professionals from the Netherlands, I have spent a week building two houses for Indian families near Pondicherry in Eastern India. 

The homes we helped to build are now homes to Dalit mothers and their children. Dalit is the name for people who are at the lowest level of India's Hindu-based caste system.  Nearly 25% of India's population are Dalit and a large majority live in extreme poverty and in dire conditions. I have spent my time doing groundwork, concrete casting, carpeting and painting. The houses are an enormous step up from current living conditions where many families live together in just one room. These homes offer some of India's poorest families ample living space including a 3-by-4 meter living room, separate kitchen, one or more bedrooms and storage. 

The project was funded by an online campaign of public and private donations and the Amsterdam office of Clifford Chance helped to fund the houses that we helped to build.  

It is almost impossible to put into words the feeling of satisfaction that comes with helping these families, having experienced the conditions they have lived in and what our support does for their future lives.

Please see short video here: https://youtu.be/Lf3khGBaWbQ

Building homes near Yogyakarta - Indonesia

After my first volunteer project back in 2014 I joined another volunteer project from 1 until 10 April 2016 with Habitat for Humanity, this time in a small village near Yogyakarta - Indonesia. This slideshow gives (http://bit.ly/1qL3bNP) gives an impression of the work we did, and please have a look at this short video https://youtu.be/qeTFz1VLyfI. Together with the Habitat Business Club Netherlands we managed to construct four houses, and by that gave hope for a better future for themselves and their children.

volunteer_experiences.role: Building homes near Siem Reap - Cambodia
volunteer_experiences.description: After two very successful volunteer projects in 2014 (Pondicherry - India) and 2016 (Yogyakarta - Indonesia) when I joined projects with Habitat for Humanity to help construct homes for oppressed families, I joined another project from 2 until 11 June 2017. Together with 12 other financial specialists we helped construct a home for a very poor family who, for many reasons, deserve to live in a decent house, being the foundation of a more secure future for their children, grandchildren and orphans. volunteer_experiences.description: The foundation World Wide for Children seeks to support children, all over the world, with a loving and caring environment with plenty of opportunities for development. It focuses on improving areas like nutrition, health, education and social security. As ambassador I have committed myself to encourage fundraising, increasing brand awareness and showing the results of projects funded by this wonderful organisation.

After three very successful volunteer projects in 2014 (Pondicherry - India), 2016 (Yogyakarta - Indonesia) and 2017 (Siem Riep - Cambodia) when I joined projects with Habitat for Humanity to help construct homes for oppressed families, I joined another project from 16 until 25 March 2018. This time in the countryside of Kabwe - Zambia. Together with 17 other volunteers we helped construct two houses for two very poor families who, for many reasons, deserve to live in a decent house, being the foundation of a more secure future for themselves and their children. Please see short video here: https://youtu.be/NpArJZVpmJM

After four very successful volunteer projects with Habitat for Humanity to help construct homes for oppressed families in Pondicherry (India), Yogyakarta (Indonesia), Siem Reap (Cambodia) and Kabwe (Zambia), I joined another project, this time in the countryside of Salima in Malawi (Africa). 
Together with a group of financial specialists and other volunteers among which the editor in chief of Happinez Magazine we helped construct a home for two very poor single women with many children who, for many reasons, deserve to live in a decent house, being the foundation of a more secure future for their children. 
For a presentation of the work performed in Pondicherry (India), Yogyakarta (Indonesia), Siem Reap (Cambodia), Kabwe (Zambia) and now also Salima (Malawi) please visit my Youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0mx58I43UEFMOmGwC9ykKA.
